name: SprinklerType
title: Sprinkler Type
description: Types of automatic fire sprinkler systems based on how water is delivered to the sprinkler heads.

concept.definition: Pipes are always filled with pressurized water; sprinkler heads discharge immediately upon activation.
Pipes are filled with compressed air or nitrogen; water flows only after a head activates and air pressure drops.
A two-step system requiring both a detection event and sprinkler head activation before water is released.
All sprinkler heads are open; the entire system discharges simultaneously when the detection system activates the valve.
High-volume heads designed to suppress a fire at its early stages rather than just controlling it, used in high-piled storage areas.
